chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm
Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Faustino Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).
  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Death), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In amount of $1,113.00 payable to Rebecca F.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant advised as a convicted felon he may  not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; also advised that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one. Credit for zero days.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Faustino Torres in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Faustino Torres in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Restitution Information and Victim Impact Statements filed with the court.  Defendant was convicted of both counts by a jury and parties waived a pre-sentence investigation.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by Rebecca F.
AS to count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 552 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS .
The defendant has stipulated to restitution in the amount of $1113.00 payable as follows:
$858.00 to Krause Funeral Homes and Cremation services
$255.00 to Highland Memorial Park
As to count 2:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 18 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to count 1.  CONFINEMENT of 12 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS with the following conditions as to both counts:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded and is to report to Dodge Correctional.
Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration and Ineligible Voting

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 664
cf
Substantive Jury Instructions

Defendant Faustino Torres in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Faustino Torres in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case was set for 8:30am and due to instructions and verdicts not being fully prepared case is not ready until 9am.  The court informs counsels that it will limit each side to 30 minutes for closings to which each counsel objects for the record.
Parties and the defendant are in agreement to the lesser included charges that will be submitted to the jury.  Count 1: Second Degree Reckless Homicide, 940.06 and Count 2: Neglecting a Child(Consequence is Great Bodily Harm), 948.21(1)(c).  Instructions and verdict forms are stipulated to by parties.
Jury in box at 9:05am.  Court continued instructions to the  jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Rebuttal argument by the state.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot (#4) and released.  
Jury retired at the hour of 10:50am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Spottek and Mason who were duly sworn for that purpose.  
At the hour of 2:40pm the jury indicated it had reached its verdicts.
COURT REPORTER DONNA RICHMOND; HON. DANIEL KONKOL presides for Judge Wagner.  Jury in the box at 3:00pm and, by their foreperson (#19), brought in the following verdicts:
Count 1: We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of Second Degree Reckless Homicide, a lesser included offense
Count 2: We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of Child Neglect-Death as a Consequence
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  State moves for entry of judgment; defense renews its motion to dismiss on grounds of insufficent evidence to convict.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction pending filing of motions by defense.  The court will allow the defense until July 22, 2015 to file any motions and if none filed the judgment shall be entered.
Parties waive a PSI.  Court orders defendant remanded and adjourns sentencing to 7-29-2015 at 8:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Faustino Torres in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Faustino Torres in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in the box at 9:30am.  Sworn for the state:  Rebecca F.  Jury out of the box at 11:00am.
Jury in the box at 11:17am.  Sworn for the state:  Diane L.; Darlene M.; recalled and previously sworn Det. Stuettgen(WAPD).  Court recesses for lunch until 1pm.  Jury out of the box at NOON.
All parties present in court at 1:00pm.  Jury in the box at 1:05pm.  Testimony of Det. Stuettgen resumed.  Jury out of the box at 1:45pm.  Jury in the box at 1:55pm.  Sworn for the state:  Det. Michael Wroblewski(WAPD); Dr. Brian Linert-Asst. Medical Examiner.  State rests subject to rebuttal.   Exhibits 1-13; 19-38 and 40 received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 2:20pm.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  
Colloquy between the court and defendant as to his choice to testify in his own behalf. Court finds decision to be knowing, free and voluntary.  Jury in the box at 2:35pm.  Sworn for the defense:  Faustino T. Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony is closed.  Jury out of the box at 3:50pm.  Court places instructions that will be read to the jury on the record which are agreed to by counsels and the defendant. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Counsels will discuss if Lesser Included charges will be presented to the jury, and the appropriate instructions will be drafted and presented to the court.  Jury in the box at 4:10pm.  Court began instructions to the jury.  The court directs jury not to discuss with anyone or conduct any independent investigation.  Jury out of the box at 4:20pm.  All parties directed to appear at 8:30am on 7-15-2015.

Defendant Faustino Torres in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Faustino Torres in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In chambers discussion held.  Case called.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Court will impanel a jury of 13 (1 alternate).  The court orders sequestration of witnesses.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:10am.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled. Court recesses for lunch and orders all parties to return by 1:00pm.
Court admonishes jury not to conduct any independant investigation.
COURT REPORTER KELLY JANOWSKI
All parties are present in court at 1:05pm.  Counsels agree that mother, Rebecca F., may be excluded from the sequestration order.  Jury in the box at 1:10pm and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Armando Suarez Del Real(WAFD); Daniel Rohde(WAFD); PO Justin Schrant(WAPD).  Jury out of the box at 2:17pm.   Jury in the box at 2:27pm.  Sworn for the state:  Sgt. Brian Havican(WAPD); Det. Heather Stuetten(WAPD).  911 call played for the jury.  Jury out of the box at 3:00pm.  Jury in the box at 3:11pm.  Sworn for the state:  Dr. Angela Rabbitt, MD-Children's Hospital.  Court recesses for the day.  Court releases jury and directs them to return at 8:55am on 7-14-2015.  Jury out of the box at 4:40pm.
AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT

Defendant Faustino Torres in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Faustino Torres in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In-chambers discussion held. Parties prepared to proceed to trial. Case remains calendared for jury trial 7/13/15 in branch 38.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Faustino Torres not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In Chambers discussion held.  Case called.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial on 7-13-2015.  Court sets another final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Faustino Torres not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting another final pretrial.  A defense expert has not been named as of yet.  State is requesting that a report be submitted to them at least a month prior to the trial date, so by June 13, 2015.
Another final pretrial is set for 6-29-2015.

Defendant Faustino Torres in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Faustino Torres in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 12 for Branch 38.
Parties had requested a meeting with Judge Wagner on Friday, March 27 to discuss the status of the trial. The court met with counsels and the defense stated that it needed to obtain an expert for this trial.  The court granted the adjournment of the trial and had all parties appear today to place on record.
The court will grant the adjournment of the trial to the pre-selected date of 7-13-2015.  The state is requesting a final pretrial date and date for the defense to advise who their expert will be.  Case is set for 5-12-2015 for final pretrial and status.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Faustino Torres not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion held.  
Case called.  Counsels state that this is a FIRM trial and will be prepared to proceed on March 30.
Court had informed parties that trial will proceed on that date, however, another judge may be presiding over the trial in this courtroom.
Atty Poulson contacted; he has matter calendared for tomorrow.  ADA Torbenson has no objection to appearing on 2-18-2015.

Defendant Faustino Torres in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Faustino Torres in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel has just been appointed and needs to review discovery that has been received.  Defendant is advised by the court that this will be his LAST counsel to be appointed to him.    Case set for final pretrial on 2-17-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 3-30-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.

The State advises the court that the autopsy report/protocol has not been completed as of today's date; state is requesting that it be done by Thursday, November 13.
A miranda hearing will not be needed as counsels will address the defined issue in briefs that are to be submitted simultaneously by 11-13-2014 and the court will render a decision on 11-17-2014.  The state will also file a response to the Denny motion filed by defense counsel.
The defendant waives any other right to a miranda or goodchild hearing.
Defense motion to admit third party evidence received and filed.

Attorney Paul A. Ksicinski in court, defendant Faustino Torres not in court, in custody, defendant's appearance is waived.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has not received the autopsy protocol; state will have report to defense by end of the week.
Defense will be filing a Denny motion by 9-30-2014.  Matter is set for motion hearing on 11-7-2014 at 8:15am.

Defendant Faustino Torres in court with attorney Paul A Ksicinski.  Defendant Faustino Torres in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court has reviewed the submissions by the parties.  The Court rules that the charges in the AMENDED Information are transactionally related to charges in the original criminal complaint and information and will allow the state to proceed on the Amended Information; Court denies the defense motion.
Defense counsel advises that he will be filing an Interlocutory Appeal.
AMENDED Information filed on 6-11-2014 charging: count 1, First Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony pursuant to 940.02(1) and count 2, Child Neglect (Resulting in Death), a class D felony pursuant to 948.21(1)(d).  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
State's Response to the Defense Motion to Dismiss the Charges Contained within the Amended Information, received and filed.

Defendant Faustino Torres in court with attorney Paul A Ksicinski.  Defendant Faustino Torres in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court will put matter over to Wednesday to allow the state to file response.  Case adjourned to 6-18-2014 for arraignment.
Motion to have Proper Standard of Review for New Charges Filed in an Information Following a Bindover When the Original Charge Stated in the Complaint is not Repeated in the Information filed.

Attorney Paul A Ksicinski in court, defendant Faustino Torres not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This case has been transferrred from calendar of Judge Flanagan.  The State has filed an amended criminal complaint and amended information that will be addressed when the defendant is present in court on June 16.
The Court is in agreement with the State that this matter does not need to go back to preliminary hearing court as charges are transactionally related.
Defense has filed a motion to adjourn the July 21 trial date; Court will address on next date.

Attorney Paul A Ksicinski in court, defendant Faustino Torres not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 On 5-28-2014, defense counsel received the State's request for a Daubert Hearing.  Today, defense counsel acknowledged receipt of pictures from the State. Due to the pending change in charge, case is now reassigned to the homicide calendar.
